frameDefinitions: An Employer ends an employment relationship with an Employee.
This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.
An Item is in a state of wetness with the possibility of the wetting Liquid being mentioned, along with the Degree of wetness. '
In this frame an Agent or Cause changes the consistency of a Patient from its Initial_state to a Result.
This  frame covers the descriptions of tastes and smells, and has one main frame element, Source.
An Assessor examines a Phenomenon to figure out its Value according to some Feature of the Phenomenon.
frameExamples: He <t>fired</t> me as annotator for being too slow.
Dad <t>taught</t> me that if you work hard, you will be OK - no matter what happens.
The mop is <t>drenched</t> with water from last night's rain.
Donna <t>thinned</t> the soup with chicken broth.
Each company is then <t>evaluated</t> for their earning potential. CNI
listRoleDefinitions: The person who is let go by their <fen>Employer</fen>.
The person (or institution) that end an employment relationship with an <fen>Employee</fen>.
The label given to a particular type of employment.

The action that the <fen>Employee</fen> is relieved from doing for the <fen>Employer</fen>

.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when an <fen>Employer</fen> fires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Employer</fen> fires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
One who instructs a <fen>Student</fen> in some area of knowledge or skill.
One who is instructed by a <fen>Teacher</fen> in skills or knowledge.
An educational establishment, such as a school or college.
The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or to a <fen>Student</fen>.
A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming.
An action which the <fen>Student</fen> is able to perform as a result of instruction.
A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.
A piece of information that the <fen>Student</fen> is informed of by the <fen>Teacher</fen>.
Educational <fen>Material</fen>, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or a <fen>Student</fen> to acquire skills or knowledge.
A role, typically professional or vocational,  that the <fen>Student</fen> is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.
FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject
The time when the teaching occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which the teaching takes place.

Consider whether a possible <fen>Place</fen> phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the <fen>Institution</fen>.
The <fen>Item</fen> takes up the <fen>Liquid</fen> through its pores.
The <fen>Liquid</fen> is a fluid or gas that permeates the <fen>Item</fen>.  It most frequently occurs in a PP Complement headed by with.
<fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that undergoes a change.
The <fen>Agent</fen> causes the change of consistency in the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-<fen>Agent</fen> which brings about the change in the <fen>Patient</fen>.
When the <fen>Patient</fen> changes consistency.
Where the the <fen>Patient</fen> changes consistency.
<fen>Perceptual_source</fen> is used for the entity that is being described. A recipe can stand in for a <fen>Perceptual_source</fen> which is a kind of food.
<fen>Sensory_attribute</fen> is used for words that describe the perception itself.
The sentient entity that evaluates the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The entity whose <fen>Value</fen> according to a <fen>Feature</fen> is being measured.
The type of property or feature that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is being judged on.
An event or procedure that allows the <fen>Assessor</fen> to evaluate the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Assessor</fen> to make the assessment.
The time at which the <fen>Assessor</fen> makes the assessment.
The location where the assessing takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>I</fex> was just fired yesterday!
Dominic Mallozzi claims <fex>United Trust Bank</fex> fired him from a job at the bank's Palmer Township branch because he's HIV positive.
Doc Rivers was fired <fex>as coach of the Orlando Magic</fex>.
I was fired <fex>from training the new actors</fex>.
Guess who just got fired <fex>today</fex>!
The phone in his small apartment in the town of Milan rang and he dreaded it. He was going to be fired <fex>right there</fex>.
She's a <fex>French</fex> Teacher
She's Studying <fex>for a Master's degree</fex>
Taut with worry, Dad taught us <fex>how to drive</fex>.
My brother taught me <fex>not to be mean to guys when I'm not interested in them</fex>.
When I was two she taught me <fex>that a quarter was 25 cents and a dime was 10 cents</fex>.
All employees have received <fex>a booklet</fex> INSTRUCTING them on how to report ` anything from unwanted touching and uncalled-for blue jokes to overt demands for sexual favours . '
When his father died he went to live with an uncle in Ka'u who trained him <fex>as a warrior</fex> during his teenage years
<fex>The mop</fex> is drenched with water.
The mop was drenched <fex> with water</fex>.
<fex>The hot water</fex> jelled the jello.
The almonds had a bitter <fex> taste</fex>.
You will also be graded <fex>on your speed of response</fex> .
<fex>The study</fex> evaluated the risk of a major quake.
<fex>This chapter</fex> evaluates the far-left's contribution to the environmentalism debate since the '70's .
The committee rated Smithers ' most loyal servant ' <fex>about a week ago</fex> .
They 'll evaluate you <fex>in that room over there</fex> , and then you 're free to go .
